remarks.format:
## Remarks The MailMessageEventArgs class provides access to the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that contains the e-mail message. Because the MailMessageEventArgs class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs> class, you can cancel sending an e-mail message in your event handler by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the MailMessageEventArgs class in an e-mail message event handler to change the contents of the message before it is sent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs> class when you want to pass a <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> object to an event handler that might modify the message before sending it.

## Remarks The Message property returns the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that contains the e-mail message data. The Message property is read-only; however, you can use the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that it returns to modify the properties of the e-mail message.
